properties.Title: Update To Civil Emergency Alert Issued By Government Of Saskatchewan
properties.Summary:
Description: Update for the Civil Emergency Alert issued by the Government of Saskatchewan. The state of emergency in Saskatchewan remains in effect. UPDATE: Phase 1 of Re-Open Saskatchewan is effective May 4, 2020. All Public Health Orders will continue to apply during implementation of Phase 1 Re-Open Saskatchewan. Updated allowable services on Phase 1 for the Northern Village of La Loche and the City of Lloydminster, can be found on the COVID 19 website at Saskatchewan.ca under Public Health Orders, Bullet Number 2, List of Critical Public Services and Allowable Business Services. Continue to practice physical distancing. Avoid gatherings with people outside your immediate household. Avoid unnecessary travel. Self-isolate if returning from foreign travel or if experiencing any symptoms. Wash your hands often. Together, we are reducing the risk. We can pull together by staying apart.
Expires: 2020-05-11T17:00:00-06:00
Originated from CAP Alert: SK Provincial Emergency Communications Centre, 2020-05-04T16:26:16-06:00, CF9E0A38-BA70-1EB5-2D31-D9CC7C5AF349
Area: Province of Saskatchewan
properties.Author: SK Provincial Emergency Communications Centre

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Heavy snow continues this morning for portions of west central Alberta. The snow is expected to taper off this afternoon with total accumulations reaching 10 to 15 cm. ### Rapidly accumulating snow could make travel difficult over some locations. Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ABstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ABStorm.
Expires: 2020-05-05T01:30:43-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-05-04T16:34:43-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1111817299.2020

properties.Title: Rainfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Rain, at times heavy, is expected. Total rainfall: near 50 mm, with locally higher amounts possible. Location: southern Avalon Peninsula. Time span: overnight tonight until Tuesday evening. ### Localized flooding in low-lying areas is possible. Rainfall warnings are issued when significant rainfall is expected. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2020-05-05T10:14:31-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-05-04T18:15:31-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1651251573.2020
Area: Avalon Peninsula Southeast, Avalon Peninsula Southwest
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Significant snowfall expected late Tuesday and Tuesday night. Total snowfall: 10 to 15 cm. Maximum wind gusts: 70 km/h. Locations: The Great Northern Peninsula. Remarks: Snow will develop over the Great Northern Peninsula Tuesday afternoon and persist through Tuesday night. The snow is expected to mix with ice pellets Tuesday overnight before changing to rain or drizzle Wednesday morning as temperatures rise. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2020-05-05T10:10:13-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-05-04T18:11:13-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2071055457.2020
Area: Northern Peninsula East, Port Saunders and the Straits
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Wet snow continues over the Alaska Highway. Rain turned to snow last night over much of the Fort Nelson region as a moist front stalled over the region. Webcams show that snow is now accumulating above about 350m asl. The snow is forecast to ease and change to rain showers this afternoon. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2020-05-05T10:06:55-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-05-04T18:07:55-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.4027790116.2020
Area: Fort Nelson
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Significant snowfall expected on Tuesday. Total snowfall: 10 to 15 cm. Maximum wind gusts: 70 km/h. Locations: Green Bay, White Bay, and the Baie Verte Peninsula. Remarks: Snow will develop in the Green Bay - White Bay area Tuesday morning and then change to rain by evening as temperatures rise. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2020-05-05T10:09:26-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-05-04T18:10:26-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2108204963.2020
Area: Green Bay - White Bay
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Frost Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Frost may damage some crops in frost-prone areas. Temperatures will fall below the freezing mark overnight Tuesday night. ### Frost advisories are issued when temperatures are expected to reach the freezing mark during the growing season, leading to potential damage and destruction to plants and crops. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2020-05-05T11:29:38-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-05-04T19:30:38-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2604181411.2020
Area: Berthierville - Saint-Gabriel area, Rawdon - Joliette area, Mascouche area, Bécancour - Villeroy area, Victoriaville area, Nicolet area, Drummondville area
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Les Suêtes Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong winds that may cause damage are expected or occurring. Maximum Les Suetes gusts: 110 km/h. Time span: this evening until after midnight. ### Les Suêtes wind warnings are issued when there is a significant risk of damaging winds. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NSstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NSStorm.
Expires: 2020-05-05T10:59:29-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-05-05T00:42:29-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0752979280.2020
Area: Inverness County - Mabou and north
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: An extended period of mixed wintry weather is expected this week. Locations: Upper Lake Melville, Eagle River, and the coast from L'Anse-au-Clair north to Hopedale. Total snowfall: potential for 15 to 30 cm. The highest amounts, which could exceed 30 cm locally, are expected over inland and higher elevations from Cartwright to Lodge Bay and through Eagle River. Some coastal areas may see less than 15 cm. Total Rainfall: generally 5 to 15 mm possible. Time span: Tuesday night through Thursday morning over southeastern areas and Wednesday morning through Thursday evening for Hopedale to Rigolet and Upper Lake Melville. Remarks: Precipitation will begin as snow and will become heavy at times Tuesday night and Wednesday morning. The snow may be mixed with rain along the coast and should eventually change to rain over all areas. More details on precipitation timing and amounts for specific areas will be included in future forecasts as more information becomes available. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2020-05-05T10:33:05-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-05-04T18:34:05-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.4285298413.2020
Area: Red Bay to L'Anse-au-Clair, Norman Bay to Lodge Bay, Cartwright to Black Tickle, Rigolet and vicinity, Postville - Makkovik, Hopedale and vicinity, Upper Lake Melville, Eagle River
properties.Author: Environment Canada
